{*DO NOT DELETE THE AFFILIATE LOADER. THAT IS WHAT PULLS IN YOUR AFFILIATE INFORMATION AND LOGO.*} {include "affiliate_loader"} The Kansas Legislature rushed through these harmful bills; tell Gov. Kelly to veto! {include "pre-header-spacing"} {* Remove beacon from text version only. *} {beacon}

{include "default_salutation"} –

We need your help.

Legislators rushed through harmful bills at the last minute, and we need you to tell Governor Kelly to veto these bills.

  • HB 2183 claims to protect election integrity, but it really only makes citizen participation tougher, especially for the elderly, disabled, people of color, and rural voters. This bill is stuffed with provisions that will make it harder to vote.
  • HB 2332 gave the Legislature more power over elections and attempts to block the executive and judicial branches from modifying election laws. This is an insult to the separation of powers that is fundamental to our democracy.
  • SB 55 targets transgender girls and women for discrimination. This bill promotes the bullying of Kansas kids, and it will cost the state revenue, as major national events – specifically from the NCAA and World Cup – will be less likely to choose Kansas as their hosting destination.

Please email Governor Kelly, and tell her to veto these harmful bills. Email her at iq@ks.lmhostediq.com (we know it's an unofficial address, but we've been assured it's the most direct way to communicate).

Snail mail can be sent to:

Office of Governor Laura Kelly
Attn: Constituent Services, Rm. 264-W
300 SW 10th Ave.
Topeka, KS 66612

Let Governor Kelly know we want what's best for Kansas and to veto these regressive bills.
